definition: to put sth on the market
to cast/to send/to throw oneself (into the river etc)/to seek refuge/to place oneself into the hands of
to put/to place/to release/to free/to let go/to let out/to set off (fireworks)
market/city/CL:個|个[ge4]
threshing floor/classifier for events and happenings: spell, episode, bout
large place used for a specific purpose/stage/scene (of a play)/classifier for sporting or recreational activities/classifier for number of exams
variant of 場|场[chang2]
variant of 場|场[chang3]

sentences.english: A powerful launching campaign resulted in the large sales of the new type of air-conditioner.
sentences.chinese: 强有力投放市场活动使该款新空调的销售额大增。

sentences.english: The taxi driver is going on about new fuel cells coming out shortly.
sentences.chinese: 出租车司机在和我聊不久将投放市场的新型燃料电池。

sentences.english: They are bringing out a new brand of soap powder next month.
sentences.chinese: 他们要在下月投放市场一种新牌洗衣粉。

sentences.english: Product "of the God card" and split the machine tool since the groove on the market since the widespread user acceptance.
sentences.chinese: 与刻槽工具自投放市场以来，深受广大用户的认可。

sentences.english: Thus, large CFB boilers can be designed and offered in the marketplace.
sentences.chinese: 因此，所设计的大型CFB锅炉能投放市场了。

sentences.english: When Viagra was launched in 1998 it was the only drug of its kind.
sentences.chinese: 1998年伟哥投放市场的时候，同类药物仅此一家。

sentences.english: The Touareg has received more than its fair share of recognition since its introduction.
sentences.chinese: 投放市场以来，途锐已经受到越来越多的认可。

sentences.english: Recently, a new generation of mirrorless cameras have hit the market.
sentences.chinese: 不过最近，新一代的无反光镜相机已投放市场。

sentences.english: When will it be time to float the new firm on the open market?
sentences.chinese: 何时才是将新公司投资债券投放市场的时机呢？

sentences.english: The Screenfridge is due to hit the market sometime in early 2005.
sentences.chinese: “屏幕冷极”将于2005年年初某个时候投放市场。

sentences.english: That's true. The quality of the products is the first priority when marketing them.
sentences.chinese: 确实如此，产品投放市场时质量是第一位的。

sentences.english: Nike is ready to launch new models of tennis shoes on the market in autumn.
sentences.chinese: 耐克公司准备于秋季将新款网球鞋投放市场。

definition: to hit the market (of a new product)
new product
to put into production/to put into operation
to be published (of art, literary works etc)/to come out/to take shape/to see the light of day
to mass-produce
to be published/to come out
to hit the market (of a new product)/to float (a company on the stock market)
to mass produce
to push out/to release/to launch/to publish/to recommend
trial sale/test marketing
goods/merchandise/product/CL:個|个[ge4]
research and development/to develop
to sell/to market/sales (representative, agreement etc)
to produce/to manufacture/to give birth to a child
to input/to throw in/to unload/to put into circulation
to localize (production)/localization
